title: Feelsbad Yasuo.

embed.description: Welcome to Ask Riot! Have a question? This week it's voice over work, a glance at vision scores, and Yasuo's frequent visits to the ban bin.. Yasuo fan art by OrekiGenya Honestly? Yasuo is badass. He's a lethal Ronin-esque character that can pull off slick moves in game, dashing and slashing everywhere, leaving chaos and death behind him...at least when he's on the enemy team.

body:
**But If Azir is going down, i'm taking you with me!**

But seriously, this was unexpected.

I suppose admitting there is a problem is the first step towards healing.
But is a rework really the way to go?

I feel like other reworks _(Brand/Zac/Sej/Darius etc.)_ have made things worse, not better.
And god forbid this one should backfire....

I honestly don't know what to think about this.
On one hand, I don't like when champs get reworked for balance reasons, It feels like a betrayal of that champion and their players, and if we are truly honest Yasuo is a really really really fun champion that many people enjoy! 

But on the other hand, he is, and has pretty much always been a big problem in one capacity or another. And that's one of the reasons I wasn't too opposed to the latest LB update, because there didn't seem to be any other clear solution.
So I don't know what to think about this.

If he does get updated, I just hope that some of the stupid interactions with his wind-wall are fixed. _(Taliyah's R for example.... Its a spine of rock that comes up through the f*cking ground...)_

replies.body: I have run so many Yasuo reworks through my head, honestly. Most revolve around his passive, windfall, and ultimate. Those are the issues.

A friend and I were thinking.

What if he had mana, but when he ulted, a percentage of his remaining mana turned into a shield, and he is manaless for the duration of his armour pen buff. 

That way, he can't just spam the shit out of you in lane, and keep you zoned with his hurricane all the time.
But when he really needs to dash in and around a teamfight, he isn't restricted by mana.
zones with what hurricane. missing a single q resets his nado. And he is officially in the top 10 squishiest champs in game, all he has is utility to play around it.

You make it sound like it's possible to miss Q?
As all my time as a Yasuo main, I could probably count on my fingers the number of times I've missed his instant melee AoE skillshot.

Just stack it on minions _(which stand still and are clusted together, so it's literally impossible to miss)_
Then sit and zone.


Ahri
Anivia
Annie
Ashe
Aurelion Sol
Azir
Brand
Caitlin
Corki
Elise

All of the above 10 champions have squishier stats than Yasuo. _(not to mention they don't have a passive shield that resets by moving.)_

I found these champs alphabetically, and only got as far as E before having all 10, I have no doubts that if I continued, id find a great many more.
Not to mention he builds tanker than most of the aforementioned champs as well.

So he is far from in the squishiest 10.
_(and still has more utility to keep him alive than they do)_
Don't bother wasting your time on Yasuo with Talon12 he makes it a mission to make sure no one thinks Yasuo is a stupid champ

Yea haha
I just cant bare to see arguments without any facts at all holding them up xD

And how much harder is it to kill all of the above (minus sol) than a yasuo.

How much of a crowd control/reliable escapes/built in sustain advantage do they have over yasuo.

ahri, anivia, ashe, brand, caitlyn and elise all have larger, ranged burst than yasuo.

How is zhonya, roa and banshee squishier than shiv/pd, ie, bloodthirster, ga, boots, last whisper item tankier than a roa zhonya and banshee, all of which the mage champions you listed build as standard, or slight variations, either way still tankier than an "average" yasuo build.

http://imgur.com/a/rpMZP

Now lets check a gold standard average where he builds "tanky"

http://imgur.com/a/2IvfU

Not even 40% winrate, your argument is starting to look quite irrelevant. 

And now some stats

http://imgur.com/a/80GHS

"Oh oh he is so broken, he always gets like 20 kills and 2 deaths. His death average is higher than his kill average.

It makes me wonder if Riot knows how to design a champion properly if they have had to rework so many old champions because of balancing issues, just look at ryze for gods sake 3 reworks and he was still overpowered so they had to heavily nerf him and now he's garbage

I think 90% of the reworks are just publicity stunts.

_"Oh look at X champ, he's all new and shiny! come play him now."_

_(oh shit we fucked up... 1 month of publicity wasnt worth the next 6 patches in balance issues.)_

9 months later 

_"Oh look at X champ, he's all new and shiny** again**! come play him."_


Look at Zed's update ffs, they took his W bonus AD and gave it to his R.... Thats it?
It didn't affect his playstyle, it didn't affect his win rate, it didn't affect the theme of the champ.

All it was is: _"we updated all the assassins, but we don't worry! we didnt want you to think we forgot your special someone."_

Yeah pretty much Riot designing champions to be ridiculously overpowered on release so they will be really popular and everyone will play them then 1 month later be like "oh wow how did this champion get pass the PBE? Woops LOL guess we might have to add a few nerfs ahaha sorry guys XDXDXD"

Prime example of this: Camille
